intro: Xylopia dehiscens, commonly known as the African pepper tree, is a member of the Annonaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open when mature, releasing seeds. Xylopia dehiscens is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
